contentList.content: A station for disassembling items into their base components or mystically extracting their magical essence.
A sturdy wooden workbench, scarred with countless marks of craftsmanship, where adventuring equipment is meticulously forged.
This band does not yet contain a gemstone
A diligently crafted leather container designed to safeguard your scrolls with elegance and sophistication.
Jeweler's tools consist of a small saw, hammer, files, pliers, and tweezers.
Smith's tools allow you to work metal, heating it to alter its shape, or work raw ingots into useful items.
Leatherworker's tools include a knife, a small mallet, an edger, a hole punch, thread, and leather scraps.
Weaver's tools allow you to create cloth and tailor it into articles of clothing.
Calligrapher's Supplies include ink, stamps, seals, quills, and a dozen sheets of parchment.
Tinker's tools include a variety of hand tools, used for disassembling.
A stylish wand with strands of weave swirling inside the gem at the tip.

Alchemist's supplies include two glass beakers, a metal frame to hold a beaker in place over an open flame, a glass stirring rod, a small mortar and pestle, and a pouch of common alchemical ingredients, including salt, powdered iron, and purified water.
Artisan's Tools contains all the tools needed to work with the Artificer stations.
Tag for tools added by Craftaholic
A leather pouch designed to hold arrows for easy retrieval during hunting or combat.
These small gemstones were sewn or woven into gowns that debutantes wore at social occasions, signifying eligibility for marriage.
Prized for its deep green hue, symbolizes nature's beauty and is sought after for its rarity and elegance.
Tag for recipes added by Craftaholic
Spodumene in the pink to purple range is known as kunzite. It gradually fades over time, a phenomenon that has earned it the intriguing moniker of the 'ghost stone.'
Red spinels were considered sacred by followers of Haela Brightaxe. Appropriate for sacrifice or recognized as boons or omens when found.
Also known as false topaz, Citrine is a variety of quartz whose color ranged from pale yellow to brown.
With its misty translucence and warm brown tones, this gem evokes ancient mysteries and invites contemplation.
A semi-precious gem used for mourning jewelry or to adorn black ceremonial dress.
A deep blue gem that embodies the allure of the night sky, captivating with its celestial beauty and rich history.
Chrysoberyl is known for its short-range scrying, earning it the name "Cat's Eye."
Also known as beryllonite, this gemstone is named after the famous sorceress Laeral Silverhand. They were signs of favor from the god Finder Wyvernspur and signs of disfavor from the god Hoar.
A variety of banded onyx characterized by alternating stripes of carnelian and white onyx.
Also known as volcanic glass, this shimmering stone is hard and quite sharp around its edges.
A rather plain leather pouch. Perfect for hiding valuable gems.
The pages inside this dusty tome appear to have pocketed sections. It seems you could fold and store your recipes in these pages.
Parent for Craftaholic Gems, for adding tags.
Tag for workbenches added by Craftaholic.
The primordial essence of solidity and strength, embodying the very essence of stability and endurance.
The ethereal essence of freedom and movement, dancing upon the winds and filling the skies with boundless energy.
The mystical essence of nature's mystique and magic, representing the whimsical allure and untamed beauty of the natural world.
The primal essence of passion and destruction, blazing with intense heat and fervor, consuming all in its path with relentless power.
The mysterious essence of darkness and concealment, shrouding the world in veils of secrecy and intrigue.
The fluid essence of life and tranquility, flowing with graceful majesty through the veins of the world, shaping landscapes and nurturing all living beings.
Tag for components added by Craftaholic
A compartmentalized pouch for holding various components.
The fur lining is kind of itchy, but these claws are sharp!
